pull.title: test: wallet_backup.py, fix intermittent failure in "restore using dumped wallet"
pull.body:
Aiming to fix #25652.

The failure arises because the test expects `init_wallet()` (the test framework function) to create a wallet with no keys. However, the function also imports the deterministic private key used to receive the coinbase coins.

This causes a race within the "restore using dumped wallet" case, where we intend to have a new wallet (with no existing keys) to test the 'importwallet()' RPC result.
The reason why this failure is intermittent is that it depends on other peers delivering the chain right after node2 startup and prior to the test 'node2.getbalance()' call and also the synchronization of the validation queue.

issue.title: tests: Run both descriptor and legacy tests within a single test invocation
issue.body: Instead of having the tests only do one type or the other, depending on command line arguments, these tests should be running with both types of wallets. Any test that calls `add_wallet_options` will be run for each wallet type that it specifies a wallet option for if none are give in the command line. If a particular wallet is specified with `--legacy-wallet` or `--descriptors`, the options are still respected.

verification.payload:
tree 77d7b4b58a273b084a2d86473f02af7ef27a79ba
parent 8372ab0ea3c88308aabef476e3b9d023ba3fd4b7
author furszy <matiasfurszyfer@protonmail.com> 1692715895 -0300
committer furszy <matiasfurszyfer@protonmail.com> 1692794484 -0300

test: wallet_backup.py, fix intermittent failure in "restore using dumped wallet"

The failure arises because the test expects 'init_wallet()' (the test
framework function) creating a wallet with no keys. However, the function
also imports the deterministic private key used to receive the coinbase coins.

This causes a race within the "restore using dumped wallet" case, where we
intend to have a new wallet (with no existing keys) to test the
'importwallet()' RPC result.
The reason behind the intermittent failures might be other peers delivering
the chain right after node2 startup (sync of the validation queue included)
and prior to the 'node2.getbalance()' check.

events.message:
test: wallet_backup.py, fix intermittent failure in "restore using dumped wallet"

The failure arises because the test expects 'init_wallet()' (the test
framework function) creating a wallet with no keys. However, the function
also imports the deterministic private key used to receive the coinbase coins.

This causes a race within the "restore using dumped wallet" case, where we
intend to have a new wallet (with no existing keys) to test the
'importwallet()' RPC result.
The reason behind the intermittent failures might be other peers delivering
the chain right after node2 startup (sync of the validation queue included)
and prior to the 'node2.getbalance()' check.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -230,7 +225,11 @@ def run_test(self):
             shutil.rmtree(os.path.join(self.nodes[2].chain_path, 'chainstate'))
 
             self.start_three(["-nowallet"])
-            self.init_three()
+            # Create new wallets for the three nodes.
+            # Provide 'import_deterministic_coinbase_key=False' to not import the deterministic
+            # coinbase key. We will use this empty wallets to test the 'importwallet()' RPC command below.
+            for node_num in range(3):
+                self.init_wallet(node=node_num, import_deterministic_coinbase_key=False)
comments.body:
```suggestion
                self.nodes[node_num].createwallet(wallet_name=self.default_wallet_name, descriptors=self.options.descriptors, load_on_startup=True)
```

`self.default_wallet_name` is already used/hard-coded elsewhere in this test, so it seems clearer to use it here as well. This would also allow to drop the changes you made to the init_wallet function?

             shutil.rmtree(os.path.join(self.nodes[2].chain_path, 'chainstate'))
 
             self.start_three(["-nowallet"])
-            self.init_three()
+            # Create new wallets for the three nodes.
+            # Provide 'import_deterministic_coinbase_key=False' to not import the deterministic
+            # coinbase key. We will use this empty wallets to test the 'importwallet()' RPC command below.
+            for node_num in range(3):
+                self.init_wallet(node=node_num, import_deterministic_coinbase_key=False)
